Package Brick.Break.Ball

Class BallController

java.lang.Object
Brick.Break.Ball.BallController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Move
Direct Known Subclasses:
RubberBallController
public abstract class BallController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Move
This is the Controller of Model class(Ball Class) in Ball MVC design pattern This is an abstract class. This class implement the methods from "Move" interface class.

  • Constructor Details

    • BallController

      public BallController​(Ball ballModel)
      This is the constructor of "BallController" class. This constructor will set the default value for the data in model class(Ball class) once it is called by another class. The method from "Speed"abstract class and "Colour" abstract class is used in this constructor which are "setInnerColour(innerColor)", "setBorderColour(borderColor)", "setXSpeed(speedX)" and "setYSpeed(speedY)".
      Parameters:
      ballModel - This parameter is the object of model class(Ball class).

  • Method Details

    • makeBall

      public abstract java.awt.Shape makeBall​(java.awt.geom.Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB)
      This is an abstract method which is used to create the ball. This method will be implemented by the child class.
      Parameters:
      center - This parameter is the position of the ball.
      radiusA - This parameter is the radius of the ball.
      radiusB - This parameter is the radius of the ball.

    • move

      public void move()
      This method is used to make the ball start moving whenever the player start the game. This method comes from "Move" interface class.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Move

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(java.awt.Point p)
      This method is used to move the ball to a specific place.
      Parameters:
      p - This parameter is the point where the ball should move to.

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints​(double width, double height)
      This method set the position of the ball's directions toward or away from the rectangle(Player).
      Parameters:
      width - This parameter is the width of the rectangle.
      height - This parameter is the height of the rectangle.

    • renderBall

      public void renderBall​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
      This method get the "drawBall" method from "BallView" class and draw out the ball to the screen.
